ach_title: ACH change from free email detection
active_fraud_description: Inspect and access new domain traffic that could be launched from third-party partners or similar organizations.
add_domains_sub_heading_description: Allow Cloudflare to scan the selected domains for security issues.
added_detections_description: Manage additional configuration settings that impact how traffic is analyzed.
anti_spam_desciption: Detect bulk email or unsolicited commercial emails and mark them with a Bulk disposition.
bec_add_users_or_group_description: Select the groups or users from your directory you want to register.
bec_email_label_description: Enter all known email addresses separated by a comma. Variations nmot listed will receive enhanced scrutiny.
bec_input_method_description: Choose how to enter your user data. We recommend only adding prominent users who are likely to be targets of impersonation attacks.
bec_one: Email variations not listed will receive enhanced scrutiny
bec_regex_label_description: Must be a valid Java expressions. We recomment testing your regex for accuracy before saving.
bec_table_description: Register users who are most likely to be targets of impersonation attacks. CES applies enhanced scrutiny to variations of registered email adressess for additional Business Email Compromise (BEC) protection. Manually add users or select from your synced directories.
bec_three: Must contain only the below fields and the first row must be the header row. Example file format:
bec_two: The file cannot be larger than 150 KB
domain_name_description: Enter main domain name (at least 2 chars)
domain_type_description: Select the type of domain you are exempting.
domains_description: View, add, and manage domains scanned by CES.
domains_status_active_tooltip: The domain connection is healthy and CES can scan its messages.
domains_status_broken_tooltip: The integration is currently broken and the domains email cannot be scanned. Visit the integration page for more details.
domains_sub_heading_description: View the domains currently scanned by CES
email_policy_allowed_patterns_descriptio: Exempt messages that match certain patterns from normal detection scanning.
email_policy_description: Manage how CES handles certain email behavior.
email_policy_recent_domain: Domains created recently. Select to prevent a domain from triggering a Suspicious or Malicious detection. Manage your 'recent domain' definition in added detections.
encrypted_attachment_description: Auto-scan encrypted attachments to detect sophisticated malware campaigns.
input_method_description: Choose how to enter your trusted domain data.
malicious_domain_description: Set the threshold for a Malicious disposition based on domain age.
notes_description: Add an optional note to describe your trusted domain.
policy_rules_added_detections_descriptio: Manage additional configuration settings. These settings may impact how traffic is analyzed and often apply to trusted business partners.
policy_rules_allowed_patterns_descriptio: Exempt messages that match certain patterns from normal detection scanning.
policy_rules_auto_retract_configuration_: Completely deletes messages from a user’s inbox.
Sends the message to the junk or spam email folder.
(MS only) Sends the message to the user’s Deleted Items folder. Messages can be recovered by the user.
Sends the message to the trash or deleted items email folder.
Review the auto-retract behavior for each disposition.
policy_rules_auto_retract_description: Automatically move messages matching certain dispositions to specific folders within a user’s mailbox.
policy_rules_bec_lists_description: Protect sensitive email addresses in your organization against impersonation.
policy_rules_blocked_senders_description: Mark all messages from specific senders with a ‘malicious’ disposition.
policy_rules_description: Customize and fine-tune email scanning behavior.
policy_rules_domains_description: View, add, and manage domains scanned by CES.
policy_rules_phish_submission_response_d: Retract emails reported by your users as phishing and found by CES to be malicious. Retraction will occur according to your configuration.
policy_rules_phishnet_description: Submit missed phish samples to CES.
policy_rules_post_deliviery_response_des: Rescan delivered emails at a fixed interval for previously unknown phishing sites or campaigns. CES retracts any messages fitting these new criteria.
policy_rules_post_deliviery_retractions_: Choose how to handle messages that were not identified as a threat when first scanned.
policy_rules_retraction_group_descriptio: Take post-delivery action against suspicious messages.
policy_rules_trusted_domains_description: Identify domains to exempt from CES detections.
proximity_domain_description: Domains with similar spelling to your existing domain. Select to prevent a domain from triggering a Spoof detection.
ps_description: Submit missed phish samples to CES for review.
ps_step_four: Paste the above URL, verify and complete the wizard.
ps_step_one: Log in to the Microsoft admin panel. Go to Microsoft 365 admin center > Settingss > Integrated Apps.
ps_sub_description: Set up the Phish Net add-in button to submit missed phish samples directly to CES.
recent_domain_description: Domains created recently. Select to prevent a domain from triggering a Suspicious or Malicious detection. Manage your definition in <button>added detections</button>.
requirement_1: The file can't be bigger than 150 KB.
requirement_2: Must contain no other fields and the first row must be the header row. An example file would look like this:
subdomain_description: Optional: Require or allow one or more subdomains. Separate domains by commas.
suspicious_domain_description: Set the threshold for a Suspicious disposition based on domain age.
top_level_domains_description: Optional: Add one or more top level domains, separated by commas.
